description: Borrowed from the Ancient Greek φιλοσόφημα (philosóphēma, “syllogism”) via Latin philosophema (“syllogism”). The Greek was formed from φιλοσοφέω (philosophéō, “to philosophize or pursue knowledge”) and the nominalizing suffix -μα (-ma).

entries.meaning: (philosophy) A philosophical statement, theorem or axiom.
examples: This, the most venerable, and perhaps the most ancient, of Grecian mythi, is a philosopheme.
